title: Bayern Munich make contact with Christian Eriksen as Germans eye January transfer
text:

Bayern Munich are reportedly interested in signing Tottenham midfielder Christian Eriksen and could make a move for the player in January.

Eriksen is said to be unhappy at Spurs and admitted over the summer that he wanted a "new challenge" following six seasons at the north London club.

With his contract set to expire in June Eriksen is almost certain to move on, and according to SPORT1 Bayern are willing to offer the 27-year-old an escape route in the January transfer window.

They claim the Bundesliga champions have already contacted Eriksen's party and he is said to be open to the idea of the move.

(Image: Getty Images)

Bayern recently humiliated Spurs 7-2 in the Champions League and Eriksen is sure to have been impressed with the clinical nature of their performance, and may fancy himself playing a role in the team.

He has not performed to his normal standards this season, but has been a crucial player during the Mauricio Pochettino era at Spurs, and was a key figure in helping them to the Champions League final last season.

In total he has made 277 appearances for Spurs in all competitions since signing in 2013, scoring 66 times, but as he enters the twilight of his career he will be looking to fulfill his talent with trophies.

Bayern already have an abundance of attacking talent in the likes of Philippe Coutinho, Serge Gnabry and Kingsley Coman, and it would be fascinating to see how Eriksen would fit into the team.

(Image: James Marsh/BPI/REX)

It remains to be seen whether any other clubs come in for him, with Real Madrid and Barcelona among those said to be interested in a deal over the summer.

Eriksen is currently away on international duty with Denmark as he tries to help his country qualify for next year's European Championship but will return to action with Spurs when they host Watford on 19 October.
description: The Danish midfielder has long been linked with a move away from Tottenham and is out of contract at the end of this season
